oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Roster of commissioned officers, Tennessee Volunteers
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: United States--History--Civil War, 1861-1865; Tennessee -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; Recruiting and enlistments; Military officers
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A handwritten roster of commissioned officers mustered into service of the United States. Included is the date of muster, company name, arm of service, where mustered, term of muster, and name and rank of officers. The document is signed by J. R. Paxton, Mustering Officer.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: United States -- War Dept. -- Adjutant-General's Office
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Record Group 21, Adjutant General's Office Records, 1796-1900
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A roster of the commissioned officers mustered into Federal Army service in September 1864 by Captain J. R. Paxton, 15th Infantry, Mustering Officer for Tennessee. The names were collected at Nashville, Tennessee.
